posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Epic Dodge, EDRIII, undead immunities, 50% slashing/piercing resistance, DR 15/+3 and a nasty scythe are the marks of this build. Add epic trap skills, stealth, UMD, crippling strike, +13d6 sneak attacks and you get a nasty undead tank to deal with.

The build is evidently min-maxed to achieve this result and combat prowess is strongly dependant on party/umd buffs. Unshifted combat has to be of the ranged type, via meatshields/party members cover or kiting supported by stealth and traps (and umd of course). The Druid levels grant a useful animal companion for the early levels, extra AB in natural areas, immunity to grease/web/entangle, wild shape 1/day (it's gonna be useful early on), access to animal empathy (for extra help) and boni to stealth and saving throws vs fear. Shifter levels are squeezed in asap to support combat in different shapes and Rogue levels are spaced in order to always be the best trapper possible. Good saves (but Will) and high hitpoints further help out balancing the weaknesses of the build. Toughness can be changed for PBS (to help ranged combat from a close distance) or Weapon Finesse and EP for AS for higher defense. I chose to rely on shifted shapes for when combat needs the extra humph and to have a stronger attack (EP) given the many defensive fetures of the build.

posts.author: Devlinor
posts.content: Looks good Kail. I'd love to try it. Is this build party dependent or is it a possible solo type? I sometimes have a problem with getting on any PW to run at a regular time, so tend to go solo a lot.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Devlinor wrote:Looks good Kail. I'd love to try it. Is this build party dependent or is it a possible solo type? I sometimes have a problem with getting on any PW to run at a regular time, so tend to go solo a lot.
It's soloable, although it requires a careful playstyle. For solo play especially I advice to get Finesse at lvl 3 instead of Toughness. Even with your animal companion (I suggest panther or dire wolf) and a dominated animal you'll end up having to melee and when that happens you want to have finesse. Traps are your friends, buy the cheap minor spike traps when you are scarce on resources they do their dirty job well enough. Entangle traps are great too. Kiting is one strategy you'll want to exploit and get your hands on some rods of frost or somesuch so that you'll always hit the mark. Try to get your sneaks in via flanking/ranged combat with meatshields keeping your enemy busy. Immunity to grease/entanglement/web is to be exploited as is the +2 AB in natural areas (which abound on WoG).

I have started this build on WoG and I expect it to be lotsa fun.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Too bad you are not here to argue your points, Kail. 

The problem is that this build is investing all that CON into qualifying for 9 points of universal DR while CON is overwritten. There will be no HP or Fort benefit from all that CON at all when shifted.  The alternative to RL is never the gimped native form.  It is another shift, usually to epic minotaur or wyrmie...  any shape that doesn't overwrite DEX.  Sorry, I don't see the value in EDR for a form that is not affected by crits, has its own DR skin, can pre-buff with added DR and concealment via UMD and could benefit much more from the added DEX AC from pumping DEX alone.

Unless I am missing something that makes the significant investment in CON so important for an undead primary shape.  In that case, someone speak up, please.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: EDRI-III is not overcome by any magical weapon of +4 or higher enchantment (as the RL shape DR instead is) as far as I can remember now that I haven't played NWN for years

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
EDR isn't penetrated by any enhancement at all and it is permanent.  So grabbing that extra 9 soak will always have value. Absolutely.

Mainly my issue was the CON commitment to gain those epic feats rather than the CON itself.  I would have increased the AC/reflex dramatically by subbing in Great DEX in most of those occasions and get Armor Skin.  Pumping DEX higher is the only viable alternative since Will saves (via WIS boosts) are not needed by Undead.  For a non-shifter I would never recommend Epic Toughness over Great CON, but in the case of an Undead Shape with its inability to heal itself without reshifting, those extra 40 HPs could help more than the 9 soak. Or maybe it's a push.

Anyway, it's great to see you found your account intact and have visited again.  This is truly a day worth the wait!
